revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-25 20:15:07.000000000', 'message': 'Replace md5 for fips

md5 is not an approved algorithm in FIPS mode, and trying to
instantiate a hashlib.md5() will fail when the system is running in
FIPS mode.

md5 is allowed when in a non-security context.  There is a plan to
add a keyword parameter (usedforsecurity) to hashlib.md5() to annotate
whether or not the instance is being used in a security context.

In the case where it is not, the instantiation of md5 will be allowed.
See https://bugs.python.org/issue9216 for more details.

Some downstream python versions already support this parameter.  To
support these versions, a new encapsulation of md5() has been added to
oslo_utils.  See https://review.opendev.org/#/c/750031/

In this case, md5 is used to calculate the hash of a database record
to ensure record uniqueness.

Change-Id: Ic2571caa71dc99c417ea0933d5d4947287cbe312

commit_message:
Replace md5 for fips

md5 is not an approved algorithm in FIPS mode, and trying to
instantiate a hashlib.md5() will fail when the system is running in
FIPS mode.

md5 is allowed when in a non-security context.  There is a plan to
add a keyword parameter (usedforsecurity) to hashlib.md5() to annotate
whether or not the instance is being used in a security context.

In the case where it is not, the instantiation of md5 will be allowed.
See https://bugs.python.org/issue9216 for more details.

Some downstream python versions already support this parameter.  To
support these versions, a new encapsulation of md5() has been added to
oslo_utils.  See https://review.opendev.org/#/c/750031/

In this case, md5 is used to calculate the hash of a database record
to ensure record uniqueness.

Change-Id: Ic2571caa71dc99c417ea0933d5d4947287cbe312

commit_message:
Add missing IPv6 support for healthcheck_port

With change I64776992a7e457781aa8ddaba359ef085d4cb77d, the IPv6 network
was overlooked, leading to issues in some cases with composable roles
and IPv6 network.

Change-Id: I55905cb299ae9e35b605f0a9219177f809d6919e
Closes-Bug: #1934772
Resolves: rhbz#1979524
(cherry picked from commit 4ea75f40b7d199ead6bb294f73dc6a8c96722ec1)

commit_message:
[Standalone Upgrade] Use output directory same as deploy

Standalone deploy already switched to <working_dir>/tripleo-deploy
in [1], for same reasons switch the standalone upgrade too.

Also when using different output directory, passwords
get's regenerated during upgrade and causing issues
like #1935691.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/+/789764

Closes-Bug: #1935691
Change-Id: If6c1892d9f3d4613163dca2a0f7f293bf076a7b6

commit_message:
Fix unreachable handling

When we clear the cached facts with unreachable nodes, we attempt to
gather facts by default. This can cause the node to be skipped for every
future playbook. This ends up bypassing all our failure percentage
logic.

CONFLICT: was lines 15,52. This is changed in Ussuri. To maintain
consistency with Train, I have kept the Train method for gathering
facts and just backported the gather_facts: false for the
"Clear cached facts" task.

Change-Id: Ie240877496b73a37f553a84af47dfebdbaf899e5
Related-Bug: 1908573
(cherry picked from commit 969693e667aba8d893f10f7b03bafde3b3f66287)
(cherry picked from commit c9ffe726f70e08f8fa564a0d86bcea01f348546c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-30 11:06:09.000000000', 'message': 'Remove NovaVncProxyNetwork from ServiceNetMap

In Icef2481b65b41b524ad44eeecfbee4451006e1d2 we moved to use
NovaLibvirtNetwork as the single network to configure instance console
components.
Due to how hieradata is being rendered via tripleo-hieradata, the
removed NovaVncProxyNetwork resulted in no-vnc-proxy service to
fall back to the control plane network because NovaVncProxyNetwork
was removed.
NovaVncProxyNetwork was then reintroduced with
I595294956a4a7a0e2280c685ac1d2543edbc32f2 but as a side effect
again introduced the inconsistency on the console configuration.

This patch removes the NovaVncProxyNetwork from ServiceNetMap
but set it as part of service_net_map.j2.yaml and keep it in
sync with NovaLibvirtNetwork.

Conflicts:
    network/service_net_map.j2.yaml
    overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.j2.yaml

Change-Id: I08fa1ee947574e6fac24885b17706a22054fcba9
Closes-Bug: #1917719
(cherry picked from commit 9da8a405952623e42f52e13ac948da1e57cf6906)
(cherry picked from commit 2f0689d8d7e4078c4e9c025c3deb9b9e0a638d05)
(cherry picked from commit d18c6e92830bb7f6d8d62204747130678aa5a61c)

commit_message:
Remove NovaVncProxyNetwork from ServiceNetMap

In Icef2481b65b41b524ad44eeecfbee4451006e1d2 we moved to use
NovaLibvirtNetwork as the single network to configure instance console
components.
Due to how hieradata is being rendered via tripleo-hieradata, the
removed NovaVncProxyNetwork resulted in no-vnc-proxy service to
fall back to the control plane network because NovaVncProxyNetwork
was removed.
NovaVncProxyNetwork was then reintroduced with
I595294956a4a7a0e2280c685ac1d2543edbc32f2 but as a side effect
again introduced the inconsistency on the console configuration.

This patch removes the NovaVncProxyNetwork from ServiceNetMap
but set it as part of service_net_map.j2.yaml and keep it in
sync with NovaLibvirtNetwork.

Conflicts:
    network/service_net_map.j2.yaml
    overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.j2.yaml

Change-Id: I08fa1ee947574e6fac24885b17706a22054fcba9
Closes-Bug: #1917719
(cherry picked from commit 9da8a405952623e42f52e13ac948da1e57cf6906)
(cherry picked from commit 2f0689d8d7e4078c4e9c025c3deb9b9e0a638d05)
(cherry picked from commit d18c6e92830bb7f6d8d62204747130678aa5a61c)

commit_message:
Enable disable_by_file backend of healthcheck middleware by default

This change introduces ironic's own defaults about healthcheck
middleware parameters, and allows to use disable_by_file backend
by default.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/800513
Change-Id: I3c935ac5f82d752f81619c1609019ec7cfbf95df

commit_message:
Fix python 3.9 unit test failures

Running the python 3.9 unit tests locally results in failures
like:

  TypeError: cannot pickle '_thread.RLock' object

Because we are inheriting some of the neutron code, and this
is fixed in that repository, just bump the minimum requirement
to 18.0.0 (Wallaby) now that it is released. This does not
happen in the gate since it is always using master.

Raised minimum of other libraries as necessary.

Change-Id: I820c924189d2973aefcb1452331c904f1ee7051f
Closes-bug: #1923083

commit_message:
Keep user defined configuration after resizing instance

* Never remove user defined config, changing the function name from
  save_configuration to reset_configuration in trove-guestagent.
* Improved some logs
* Do not remove Innodb Log Files after resize which will cause error:
  Can't open and lock privilege tables: Table './mysql/user' is marked
  as crashed and should be repaired

Story: 2009033
Task: 42773
Change-Id: I9e3165ed9b38b15714542e35456415e65d438497
(cherry picked from commit c274ab9f1a9b270c0ec2cb2d4aebe052aa37d416)

commit_message:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 33130, 'date': '2021-06-29 05:45:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 33130, 'date': '2021-06-29 05:46:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 30449, 'date': '2021-06-30 14:55:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

So this hook is for job execution order? or, for the upgrade of immutable fields?'}, {'account_id': 33130, 'date': '2021-06-30 15:02:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 4:
> 
> So this hook is for job execution order? or, for the upgrade of immutable fields?

As we have used three hook, post-install and post-upgrade will force the resources to be created at the last which will solve the immutable problem.
Hook weight value "5" means this job will be the last one to be executed if the hook is added to any other jobs.
And hook delete policy is for deleting the job just before the update of the job.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2021-06-30 22:25:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 4:
> 
> So this hook is for job execution order? or, for the upgrade of immutable fields?

it's also both for immutable fields upgrade too!"}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2021-06-30 22:26:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2021-07-08 14:36:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Please wrap these in a conditional that can be set, ie similar to this:

commit_message:
Added the helm hook for create user job for exporter

exporter-jpb-create-user was failing due to the field immutability
which was resulting in the manual delete of the job for every helm
upgrade to be successful. Reason being job being upgraded before the
other manifest that are required been updated. It can be avoided by
using helm-hook post-install and post-upgrade which will force the
job manifest to be applied only after all other manifest are applied.
Hook annotation is provided "5" so that the if other jobs are annotated,
exporter job will be last to created.
helm3_hook value is used for the condition which will enable the disable
of the hook.

Change-Id: I2039abb5bad07a19fd09fc5e245485c3c772beca

messages: [{'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2021-07-12 19:53:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2021-07-12 21:06:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nlgtm'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2021-07-12 21:10:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-12 19:53:43.000000000', 'message': "Clarify our affected versions conventions

The old impact description template was slightly misleading in its
use of <= to clamp upper bounds of affected versions. For many years
we've actually been using a strict < of the next possible SemVer
patchlevel version, so correct the examples and add a brief
paragraph to explain the construction in greater detail.

Change-Id: I44db2454bd1cd8691f445a0dcd403b8fa2681de3
"}]
commit_message:
Clarify our affected versions conventions

The old impact description template was slightly misleading in its
use of <= to clamp upper bounds of affected versions. For many years
we've actually been using a strict < of the next possible SemVer
patchlevel version, so correct the examples and add a brief
paragraph to explain the construction in greater detail.

Change-Id: I44db2454bd1cd8691f445a0dcd403b8fa2681de3

commit_message:
Keep user defined configuration after resizing instance

* Never remove user defined config, changing the function name from
  save_configuration to reset_configuration in trove-guestagent.
* Improved some logs
* Do not remove Innodb Log Files after resize which will cause error:
  Can't open and lock privilege tables: Table './mysql/user' is marked
  as crashed and should be repaired

Story: 2009033
Task: 42773
Change-Id: I9e3165ed9b38b15714542e35456415e65d438497
(cherry picked from commit c274ab9f1a9b270c0ec2cb2d4aebe052aa37d416)

commit_message:
Use default nodeset for functional jobs

Specifying specific nodes for these jobs was a holdover from
ussuri.  For wallaby and victoria, py36 and py38 should be
available on all nodes, so we can just use the default.

original commit message:
Run functional job on Ubuntu Focal

Devstack is planning to remove the Ubuntu
Bionic support.
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/788754

Before that we need to switch Bionic job to focal.
devstack-tox-functional define the latest nodeset which is
single node focal currently so removing nodeset setting from
python-cinderclient functional jobs.

Change-Id: Ibbbfb20c86bb2ea0d3d74f6a6a1bc913874f67ad
(cherry picked from commit f54b873ca3f9900e17b42f3600a20a36abe2b1a7)
(cherry picked from commit 7d890c66b549e3da5c3efad4d1703f5aca1e24e9)

commit_message:
Added helm hook for rabbitmq job cluster wait

Job wait cluster was failing due to the field immutability which was
resulting in the manual delete of the job for every helm upgrade to be
successful. Reason being job being upgraded before the other manifest
that are required been updated. It can be avoided by using helm-hook
post-install and post-upgrade which will force the job manifest to be
applied only after all other manifest are applied. Hook annotation is
provided "5" so that the if other jobs are annotated, exporter job will
be last to created in case hooks are added to the other jobs in chart.
Also helm3_hook value is used for condition.

Change-Id: Ib83f1d4bef6300c2b76aa54f08927b74346184c7

[{'account_id': 7294, 'date': '2021-03-24 03:23:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7294, 'date': '2021-03-24 03:24:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2021-03-24 07:44:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Thank you, this looks good to me.

The management interface for rabbitmq was enabled in https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/d6727aff73276446f34dde4de724984bc381fa3f#diff-0c90bc0e50e879119233ceea5924cb988e345105301cd4a23774385756249bc2'}, {'account_id': 30893, 'date': '2021-03-24 17:47:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Has it been tested to work?'}, {'account_id': 7294, 'date': '2021-03-24 18:12:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 30893, 'date': '2021-03-24 18:31:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

Test evidence is convincing that this makes things better not worse.'}, {'account_id': 7294, 'date': '2021-03-25 11:54:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Did a verification test with this configuration:

parameter_defaults:
  ControllerExtraConfig:
    rabbitmq::management_ip_address: "%{hiera('rabbitmq::interface')}"
    tripleo::profile::base::metrics::collectd::python_read_plugins:
      - python-collectd-rabbitmq
    collectd::plugin::python::modules:
      collectd_rabbitmq_monitoring:
        config:
          - host: "%{hiera('rabbitmq::interface')}"
            port: "%{hiera('rabbitmq::management_port')}"
            username: "%{hiera('rabbitmq::default_user')}"
            password: "%{hiera('rabbitmq::default_pass')}"
            interval: 30


Unfortunately it just confirms that the management_port parameter is not exposed enough to allow a lookup of that value out of the default puppet configuration.

Adding that is not in scope for this change. Current configuration does not work (invalid port reference, management_ip_address exposed to 127.0.0.1 by default).'}, {'account_id': 22954, 'date': '2021-05-06 12:19:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7294, 'date': '2021-07-12 20:29:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

Upon further review and suggestions there is more testing and work to be done here. Moving to -1 on the workflow.'}]

commit_message:
Update collectd-read-rabbitmq

Update collectd-read-rabbitmq to expose the management IP on the
rabbitmq::interface. Adjust the python configuration for collectd so
that it connects to the management port of 15672 vs the AMQP client
interface. Add the required interval value at a default value of 30.

Change-Id: I9385ece5d98cbf63ab99622cfcdcfa6df890896a

This patch moves back the haproxy validation from validations-common to
tripleo-validations. It has been renamed in tripleo-haproxy and the role
is called now tripleo_haproxy.

This patch also fix the host targeting in order to only execute this
validation on nodes where haproxy is really installed and configured.

commit_message:
Migrate back haproxy validation to tripleo-validations

This patch moves back the haproxy validation from validations-common to
tripleo-validations. It has been renamed in tripleo-haproxy and the role
is called now tripleo_haproxy.

This patch also fix the host targeting in order to only execute this
validation on nodes where haproxy is really installed and configured.

Note that the haproxy validations hosted in validations-common will be
removed in a follow up patch.

Closes-Bug: #1926024

Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I9869afd60342fdb0aca69a313c1c6e35e0947fb8
(cherry picked from commit 9dd662a1b9d5617e1a929c86f6ffdb09e873252b)
(cherry picked from commit 253a16de422b5f22bb1b9e68ffa14e855a22d243)
(cherry picked from commit bb5a538a56bc860c25ec32866ec25923099cbecc)
(cherry picked from commit 2744976e606e87e8f4c3c9da0ab7d6018c3f1f2d)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-10 13:34:58.000000000', 'message': 'Compute TSX validation

RHEL-8.3 kernel disabled the Intel TSX (Transactional
Synchronization Extensions) feature by default as a preemptive
security measure, but it breaks live migration from RHEL-7.9
(or even RHEL-8.1 or RHEL-8.2) to RHEL-8.3.

Operators are expected to explicitly define the TSX flag in
their KernelArgs for the compute role to prevent live-migration
issues during the upgrade process.

This also impacts upstream CentOS systems.

Co-Authored-By: Martin Schuppert <mschuppert@redhat.com>
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/1923165
Closes-Bug: #1916758
Change-Id: Icfcfb1c07bbfbe05d27d67187d941c0c34fad2b2
(cherry picked from commit ede25c3e36a751daf68ce151521b371bb25f50dc)

commit_message:
Compute TSX validation

RHEL-8.3 kernel disabled the Intel TSX (Transactional
Synchronization Extensions) feature by default as a preemptive
security measure, but it breaks live migration from RHEL-7.9
(or even RHEL-8.1 or RHEL-8.2) to RHEL-8.3.

Operators are expected to explicitly define the TSX flag in
their KernelArgs for the compute role to prevent live-migration
issues during the upgrade process.

This also impacts upstream CentOS systems.

Co-Authored-By: Martin Schuppert <mschuppert@redhat.com>
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/1923165
Closes-Bug: #1916758
Change-Id: Icfcfb1c07bbfbe05d27d67187d941c0c34fad2b2
(cherry picked from commit ede25c3e36a751daf68ce151521b371bb25f50dc)
(cherry picked from commit 74c30cf49147dedad2944da332b58079bc703200)
(cherry picked from commit 1d8c110b52bf90db9efaf55b4f071a1233270163)

commit_message:
Introduce new Ansible validation_init role.

This patch migrates the new role addition playbook into a proper Ansible
role with proper molecule tests. This new role will be responsible for
creating a new validation.

It is good to mention that the process won't change and it will be
fully transparent for the user.

To create a new role in tripleo-validations:

$ cd tripleo-validations/
$ export ANSIBLE_ROLES_PATH="${PWD}/roles"
$ ansible-playbook -i localhost, role-addition.yml -e validation_init_role_name=${NEWROLENAME}

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I219f4054e6b854306719b9c91a0738c526f07666
(cherry picked from commit 83ba5e32fdf617d2669b5ed83517729b470a7cd5)
(cherry picked from commit 19bb19ea3c74feec3ceb6e6c31b14ca5855dae16)
(cherry picked from commit fc7ab69ef0f9b69611d08d78244440d7145ff96c)
(cherry picked from commit d32efebfae1e0b0dc640957316e54f2c468554b9)

commit_message:
Remove workaround for tox-ansible and global molecule config

[1] has been merged and released[2] in upstream tox-ansible and it is now
able to manage global molecule configuration. The workaround, which
consisted in adding the molecule driver name in each scenarios
molecule.yml files, is not necessary anymore.

This patch also removes all the relative symlink to the Dockerfile and
adds directly in the global molecule configuration file.

[1] https://github.com/ansible-community/tox-ansible/pull/89
[2] https://github.com/ansible-community/tox-ansible/releases/tag/v1.5.0

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I259c17b7a49ff5bf3476df4da399cc4b2782403d
(cherry picked from commit c551910cf5f4ba0b6b00c45ae87ba325d9538baf)
(cherry picked from commit f3cba823d7424277402720946c76f2f78730e046)
(cherry picked from commit 12dd20e3b55e96d88468531f8752b9bcea21360b)

[{'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-04-09 09:18:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2021-04-09 14:27:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded. For checking Nova with Ceph, add a comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Ceph Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/785584/1/iscsi : SUCCESS in 2h 49m 15s'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-04-26 14:50:04.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to bug/1917619'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-04-27 08:09:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-07-12 19:23:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Clean cherry pick from wallaby, where the patch has merged. LGTM.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-09 09:18:36.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Simplify device_path check in _detach_encryptor

Introduced by Id670f13a7f197e71c77dc91276fc2fba2fc5f314 to resolve bug
 #1821696 this check was put in place to ensure _detach_encryptor did not
attempt to use the os-brick encryptors with an unsupported volume type
after libvirt secrets had been removed outside the control of Nova.

With the introduction of the [workarounds]disable_native_luksv1 via
Ia500eb614cf575ab846f64f4b69c9068274c8c1f however the use of
_allow_native_luksv1 as part of this check is no longer valid. As this
helper was updated to return False when the workaround is enabled,
regardless of the underlying volume being attached natively or not.

If an admin had enabled the workaround after users had launched
instances with natively attached encrypted volumes *and* the libvirt
secrets had gone missing _detach_encryptor would attempt to use the
os-brick encryptors. This would fail when the underlying volume type is
unsupported, for example rbd. See bug #1917619 for an example.

This change resolves this corner case by dropping the use of
_allow_native_luksv1 from the check and just asserting that a
device_path is present for an encrypted volume before allowing the use
of the os-brick encryptors. As noted this is safe as calls to the
encryptors are idempotent, ignoring failures to detach when the
underlying volume type is supported.

Closes-Bug: #1917619
Change-Id: Iba40c2df72228b461767d5734d5a62403d9f2cfa
(cherry picked from commit 4908daed96ddda492ced6cbb084abe8f33a8b1f7)
(cherry picked from commit f99f667a96a357adc0070d75b5940e76726f9664)
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Simplify device_path check in _detach_encryptor

Introduced by Id670f13a7f197e71c77dc91276fc2fba2fc5f314 to resolve bug
 #1821696 this check was put in place to ensure _detach_encryptor did not
attempt to use the os-brick encryptors with an unsupported volume type
after libvirt secrets had been removed outside the control of Nova.

With the introduction of the [workarounds]disable_native_luksv1 via
Ia500eb614cf575ab846f64f4b69c9068274c8c1f however the use of
_allow_native_luksv1 as part of this check is no longer valid. As this
helper was updated to return False when the workaround is enabled,
regardless of the underlying volume being attached natively or not.

If an admin had enabled the workaround after users had launched
instances with natively attached encrypted volumes *and* the libvirt
secrets had gone missing _detach_encryptor would attempt to use the
os-brick encryptors. This would fail when the underlying volume type is
unsupported, for example rbd. See bug #1917619 for an example.

This change resolves this corner case by dropping the use of
_allow_native_luksv1 from the check and just asserting that a
device_path is present for an encrypted volume before allowing the use
of the os-brick encryptors. As noted this is safe as calls to the
encryptors are idempotent, ignoring failures to detach when the
underlying volume type is supported.

Closes-Bug: #1917619
Change-Id: Iba40c2df72228b461767d5734d5a62403d9f2cfa
(cherry picked from commit 4908daed96ddda492ced6cbb084abe8f33a8b1f7)
(cherry picked from commit f99f667a96a357adc0070d75b5940e76726f9664)

commit_message:
Rabbitmq upgrade

This ps updates the following:'
- upgrade to rabbitmq 3.8.12
- make use of the new RABBITMQ_FEATURE_FLAGS
- add a preStop job to stop_app for a more graceful shutdown

Change-Id: Idc30ea0934c6dca728b0558b998644a5690f7b91

commit_message:
Switch identity groups and users in cloud layer

Methods for identity groups and users now also use proxy layer.
Also here drop some parts of the v2 support (only cloud layer).

Change-Id: Iae7c798df8780d8aa70ed54dc4b9eebd9c52b901

commit_message:
gracefully exit daemonserver before registry exit

If the registry manager is stopped while daemon server is still
processing requests, the pending requests fail and result in resource
leaks in ovs.

With this change, we wait for DaemonServer to finish processing before
shutting down the registry manager.

Closes-bug: 1856109
Change-Id: I37498ae7bf6a8b4b14afe53d1af3fb8823d589cf
Signed-off-by: Yash Gupta <y.gupta@samsung.com>
Co-Authored-By: Michał Dulko <mdulko@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add func test for nova-manage db archive_deleted_rows --before

This is inspired by database query filtering that occurs when --before
is passed to nova-manage db archive_deleted_rows. There is a comparison
WHERE deleted_at < before and not all database records populate it.

This verifies that no records are missed due to that comparision when
archiving with --before.

Related-Bug: #1751192

Change-Id: I44b79cfb236e94444740e32b0dd0a2344c29f340

[{'account_id': 32102, 'date': '2021-06-13 03:25:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 32102, 'date': '2021-06-14 15:31:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 25701, 'date': '2021-06-16 04:16:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Hi Manpreet, From my quick survey, it might be because sqlalchemy and sqlalchemy-filters are maintained separately. In sqlalchemy, there was some change moving `_join_entities` from `lib/sqlalchemy/orm/query.py` to `lib/sqlalchemy/orm/context.py` in [1], but no update in sqlalchemy-filters for that. So, we may need to update sqlalchemy-filters for the update, or ask to community, although sqlalchemy-filters has not updated recently. [1] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/commit/dce8c7a125cb99fad62c76cd145752d5afefae36'}, {'account_id': 32102, 'date': '2021-06-16 05:23:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: > Patch Set 2: > > Hi Manpreet, > > From my quick survey, it might be because sqlalchemy and sqlalchemy-filters are maintained separately. In sqlalchemy, there was some change moving `_join_entities` from `lib/sqlalchemy/orm/query.py` to `lib/sqlalchemy/orm/context.py` in [1], but no update in sqlalchemy-filters for that. > > So, we may need to update sqlalchemy-filters for the update, or ask to community, although sqlalchemy-filters has not updated recently. > > [1] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/commit/dce8c7a125cb99fad62c76cd145752d5afefae36 Thank you Ogawa san for sharing. Indeed we could ask community for update. Yesterday, while investigating I came across an alternative solution. The "aodh" project is using a customize "apply_filters" method [1]. I tried this method implementation in local environment for tacker and it worked fine. Could we customize method in tacker. Please share your valuable opinion. [1] https://github.com/openstack/aodh/blob/master/aodh/storage/impl_sqlalchemy.py#L58'}, {'account_id': 25701, 'date': '2021-06-16 06:31:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Hi, Do you mean you drop sqlalchemy-filters instead of using code from aodh? Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 31857, 'date': '2021-07-08 14:37:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: > Thank you so much Ueha san for sharing information. > Meanwhile shall I prepare this patch by merging your test patch changes. > Please share your opinion. > > Thanks! Does anyone know?'}, {'account_id': 25701, 'date': '2021-07-09 02:37:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: > Patch Set 10: > > > Patch Set 10: > > > > > Patch Set 9: > > > > > > > Thank you so much Ueha san for sharing information. > > > > Meanwhile shall I prepare this patch by merging your test patch changes. > > > > Please share your opinion. > > > > > > > > Thanks! > > > > > > Yes, I think good to apply the fix of my test patch and wait for the aodh patch is merged. > > > > > > It is recognized that the multinode-legacy error is due to the aodh error and has nothing relation with SQLAlchemy migration. > > > By applying my patch changes, I think we don't have to wait for the SQLAlchemy issue to be fixed as we disscussed in irc this week. > > > > Thanks for revert. I have uploaded Patchset 10 with merged changes. > > Yes, we are good to go without sqlalchemy_filters update. > > Thanks for your quick patch! [{'created': '2021-06-13 03:25:20.000000000', 'message': 'Fix migration for sqlalchemy 1.4

This patch fixes a database migration for sqlalchemy 1.4.

In tacker repository following issues are encounter:

1.Replace deprecated SQLAlchemy "with_lockmode" method.
  The method was deprecated in sqlalchemy 0.9 [1][2]
  and finally removed in version 1.4.
  This patch replaces "with_lockmode" with new method
  "with_for_update", which has no end-user impact.

2. The clause column IN, in the new version it requires parameters
   passed to operator either be a list of literal value
   or a tuple, or an empty list [3].

3. Fix SA Warning to enable/disable "cache_ok" flag.
   Warning: SAWarning: TypeDecorator Uuid(length=36) will
   not produce a cache key because the ``cache_ok`` flag
   is not set to True. Set this flag to True if this type
   object's state is safe to use in a cache key, or False
   to disable this warning.

4. Observe an argument error in 'update' query.
   Error: sqlalchemy.exc.ArgumentError: subject table for an INSERT,
   UPDATE or DELETE expected, got Column('id', Uuid(length=36),
   table=<vnf_software_images>, primary_key=True, nullable=False,
   default=ColumnDefault(<function generate_uuid at 0x7fb5be371d30>))

[1] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/13/changelog/migration_09.html?highlight=with_lockmode#new-for-update-support-on-select-query
[2] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/13/orm/query.html#sqlalchemy.orm.query.Query.with_lockmode
[3] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/sqlelement.html#sqlalchemy.sql.expression.ColumnElement.in_

Change-Id: Ifd1ae2753c639f22fc1afa020222416fe79469ef
'}, {'created': '2021-06-14 15:31:20.000000000', 'message': 'Fix migration for sqlalchemy 1.4

This patch fixes a database migration for sqlalchemy 1.4.

In tacker repository following issues are encounter:

1. Replace deprecated SQLAlchemy "with_lockmode" method.
   The method was deprecated in sqlalchemy 0.9 [1][2]
   and finally removed in version 1.4.
   This patch replaces "with_lockmode" with new method
   "with_for_update", which has no end-user impact.

2. The clause column IN, in the new version it requires parameters
   passed to operator either be a list of literal value
   or a tuple, or an empty list [3].

3. Fix SA Warning to enable/disable "cache_ok" flag.
   Warning: SAWarning: TypeDecorator Uuid(length=36) will
   not produce a cache key because the ``cache_ok`` flag
   is not set to True. Set this flag to True if this type
   object's state is safe to use in a cache key, or False
   to disable this warning.

4. Observe an argument error in 'update' query.
   Error: sqlalchemy.exc.ArgumentError: subject table for an INSERT,
   UPDATE or DELETE expected, got Column('id', Uuid(length=36),
   table=<vnf_software_images>, primary_key=True, nullable=False,
   default=ColumnDefault(<function generate_uuid at 0x7fb5be371d30>))

5. The INSERT statement requires values to add in table as a list,
   tuple or dictionary [4].
   Error: sqlalchemy.exc.ArgumentError: mapping or sequence expected
          for parameters
   This patch creates a dictionary of fields to be insert in VnfLcmOpOccs
   table.

[1] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/13/changelog/migration_09.html?highlight=with_lockmode#new-for-update-support-on-select-query
[2] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/13/orm/query.html#sqlalchemy.orm.query.Query.with_lockmode
[3] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/sqlelement.html#sqlalchemy.sql.expression.ColumnElement.in_
[4] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/dml.html#dml-class-documentation-constructors

Change-Id: Ifd1ae2753c639f22fc1afa020222416fe79469ef
'}, {'created': '2021-06-16 07:23:08.000000000', 'message': 'Fix migration for sqlalchemy 1.4

This patch fixes a database migration for sqlalchemy 1.4.

In tacker repository following issues are encounter:

1. Replace deprecated SQLAlchemy "with_lockmode" method.
   The method was deprecated in sqlalchemy 0.9 [1][2]
   and finally removed in version 1.4.
   This patch replaces "with_lockmode" with new method
   "with_for_update", which has no end-user impact.

2. The clause column IN, in the new version it requires parameters
   passed to operator either be a list of literal value
   or a tuple, or an empty list [3].

3. Fix SA Warning to enable/disable "cache_ok" flag.
   Warning: SAWarning: TypeDecorator Uuid(length=36) will
   not produce a cache key because the ``cache_ok`` flag
   is not set to True. Set this flag to True if this type
   object's state is safe to use in a cache key, or False
   to disable this warning.

4. Observe an argument error in 'update' query.
   Error: sqlalchemy.exc.ArgumentError: subject table for an INSERT,
   UPDATE or DELETE expected, got Column('id', Uuid(length=36),
   table=<vnf_software_images>, primary_key=True, nullable=False,
   default=ColumnDefault(<function generate_uuid at 0x7fb5be371d30>))

5. The INSERT statement requires values to add in table as a list,
   tuple or dictionary [4].
   Error: sqlalchemy.exc.ArgumentError: mapping or sequence expected
          for parameters
   This patch creates a dictionary of fields to be insert in
   VnfLcmOpOccs table.

6. Query fails on applying filters.
   When applying query to list vnf package or vnf instance using
   apply_filters() method exported from sqlalchemy_filters,
   it failed.
   AttributeError: 'Query' object has no attribute '_join_entities'

   In SQLAlchemy 1.4 unification of "query" and "select" construct
   took place [5][6].
   The issue observe in tacker is an open bug of SQLAlchemy [7].
   This patch drops "sqlalchemy_filters" and add customize method
   to apply filters in query.

[1] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/13/changelog/migration_09.html?highlight=with_lockmode#new-for-update-support-on-select-query
[2] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/13/orm/query.html#sqlalchemy.orm.query.Query.with_lockmode
[3] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/sqlelement.html#sqlalchemy.sql.expression.ColumnElement.in_
[4] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/dml.html#dml-class-documentation-constructors
[5] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/issues/5159
[6] https://gerrit.sqlalchemy.org/c/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/+/1599/
[7] https://github.com/juliotrigo/sqlalchemy-filters/issues/61

Change-Id: Ifd1ae2753c639f22fc1afa020222416fe79469ef

This patch fixes a database migration for sqlalchemy 1.4.

In tacker repository following issues are encounter:

1. Replace deprecated SQLAlchemy "with_lockmode" method.
   The method was deprecated in sqlalchemy 0.9 [1][2]
   and finally removed in version 1.4.
   This patch replaces "with_lockmode" with new method
   "with_for_update", which has no end-user impact.

2. The clause column IN, in the new version it requires parameters
   passed to operator either be a list of literal value
   or a tuple, or an empty list [3].

3. Observe an argument error in 'update' query.
   Error: sqlalchemy.exc.ArgumentError: subject table for an INSERT,
   UPDATE or DELETE expected, got Column('id', Uuid(length=36),
   table=<vnf_software_images>, primary_key=True, nullable=False,
   default=ColumnDefault(<function generate_uuid at 0x7fb5be371d30>))

4. The INSERT statement requires values to add in table as a list,
   tuple or dictionary [4].
   Error: sqlalchemy.exc.ArgumentError: mapping or sequence expected
          for parameters
   This patch creates a dictionary of fields to be insert in
   VnfLcmOpOccs table.

5. Query fails on applying filters.
   When applying query to list vnf package or vnf instance using
   apply_filters() method exported from sqlalchemy_filters,
   it failed.
   AttributeError: 'Query' object has no attribute '_join_entities'

   In SQLAlchemy 1.4 unification of "query" and "select" construct
   took place [5][6].
   The issue observe in tacker is an open bug of SQLAlchemy [7].
   This patch drops "sqlalchemy_filters" and add customize method
   to apply filters in query.

The tacker-functional-devstack-multinode-legacy test were failing due
to aodh-client exception, added depend on the patch [8].

Note: This patch address sqlalchemy errors, SAWarnings will be resolve
in future patches.

commit_message:
Fix migration for SQLAlchemy 1.4

This patch fixes a database migration for SQLAlchemy 1.4.

In tacker repository following issues are encounter:

1. Replace deprecated SQLAlchemy "with_lockmode" method.
   The method was deprecated in SQLAlchemy 0.9 [1][2]
   and finally removed in version 1.4.
   This patch replaces "with_lockmode" with new method
   "with_for_update", which has no end-user impact.

2. The clause column IN, in the new version it requires parameters
   passed to operator either be a list of literal value
   or a tuple, or an empty list [3].

3. Observe an argument error in 'update' query.
   Error: sqlalchemy.exc.ArgumentError: subject table for an INSERT,
   UPDATE or DELETE expected, got Column('id', Uuid(length=36),
   table=<vnf_software_images>, primary_key=True, nullable=False,
   default=ColumnDefault(<function generate_uuid at 0x7fb5be371d30>))

4. The INSERT statement requires values to add in table as a list,
   tuple or dictionary [4].
   Error: sqlalchemy.exc.ArgumentError: mapping or sequence expected
          for parameters
   This patch creates a dictionary of fields to be insert in
   VnfLcmOpOccs table.

5. Query fails on applying filters.
   When applying query to list vnf package or vnf instance using
   apply_filters() method exported from sqlalchemy_filters,
   it failed.
   AttributeError: 'Query' object has no attribute '_join_entities'

   In SQLAlchemy 1.4 unification of "query" and "select" construct
   took place [5][6].
   The issue observe in tacker is an open bug of SQLAlchemy [7].
   This patch drops "sqlalchemy_filters" and add customize method
   to apply filters in query.

Note: This patch address sqlalchemy errors, SAWarnings will be resolve
in future patches.

[1] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/13/changelog/migration_09.html?highlight=with_lockmode#new-for-update-support-on-select-query
[2] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/13/orm/query.html#sqlalchemy.orm.query.Query.with_lockmode
[3] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/sqlelement.html#sqlalchemy.sql.expression.ColumnElement.in_
[4] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/dml.html#dml-class-documentation-constructors
[5] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/issues/5159
[6] https://gerrit.sqlalchemy.org/c/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/+/1599/
[7] https://github.com/juliotrigo/sqlalchemy-filters/issues/61

Co-Authored-By: Ayumu Ueha <ueha.ayumu@fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: Ifd1ae2753c639f22fc1afa020222416fe79469ef

commit_message:
Extend support for custom Grafana dashboards

The current behaviour is to support supplying a single
folder of Grafana dashboards which can then be populated
into a single folder in Grafana. Some users may wish
to have sub-folders of Dashboards, and load these into
separate dashboard folders in Grafana via a custom
provisioning file. For example, a user may have a
sub-folder of Ceph dashboards that they wish to keep
separate from OpenStack dashboards. This patch supports
sub-folders whilst not affecting the original mechanism.

Trivial-Fix

Change-Id: I9cd289a1ea79f00cee4d2ef30cbb508ac73f9767

commit_message:
molecule-requirements constraints

By placing further constraints on the versions of the
requested packages, we can minimize the time used by
the pip resolver mechanism. [1]

[1](https://github.com/pypa/pip/issues/9215)

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ia3641f8b840e4d5e82fe47242609c1d1e997fa1b

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: I378644df79feae8f90b4eba60bb979f5c9fbc60a

messages: [{'account_id': 31828, 'date': '2021-05-13 12:02:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2021-05-19 13:29:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28356, 'date': '2021-07-12 14:26:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 33546, 'date': '2021-07-12 14:27:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1\n\nLooks good'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-13 12:02:01.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I47bfd89850444ba894f54d373658bea2a1573ac0
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I47bfd89850444ba894f54d373658bea2a1573ac0

subject: Revert "Make py3 default tox target flexible"
messages:
[{'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2021-06-03 18:03:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-06-03 18:51:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

I don't think we should do a straight revert here (see comments inline).  Also, I'm having second thoughts about this after reading fungi's email that Sean linked to in the patch you're reverting:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014810.html

There doesn't seem to be a good solution.  If we leave it the way it is, the unit tests are run in a python we don't support but the pep8 and compliance tests are run also.  If we say the tests must be run with a particular python that the person doesn't have available, they can always still run the unit tests with 'tox -e py39' ... but then they might not bother to run pep8 and compliance.

I think what we want here is to let someone type 'tox' and go make some coffee and come back to find some kind of useful result.  For that, I think the best solution may be py3 in the default tox list and skip_missing_interpreters=false ... in other words, Sean's original patch."}, {'account_id': 28801, 'date': '2021-06-03 19:07:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build failed.

- dsvm-tempest-cisco-zonemanager-job http://173.39.89.136/logs/61/794661/1/check/dsvm-tempest-cisco-zonemanager-job/8afe15f/ : FAILURE in 58m 15s'}, {'account_id': 26537, 'date': '2021-06-03 19:48:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Cinder Windows CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Cinder Windows CI

- cinder-iscsi http://cloudbase-ci.com/cinder/794661/1/iscsi/ : FAILURE in 1h 44m 00s
- cinder-smb http://cloudbase-ci.com/cinder/794661/1/smb/ : FAILURE in 1h 36m 45s'}, {'account_id': 21884, 'date': '2021-06-03 21:56:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Build succeed.

- DellEMC_Unity_FC http://publiclogs.emc.com/61/794661/1/check/DellEMC_Unity_FC/ee43e2f/DellEMC_Unity_FC/219 : SUCCESS in 1h 41m 43s
- DellEMC_Unity_iSCSI http://publiclogs.emc.com/61/794661/1/check/DellEMC_Unity_iSCSI/0d7e4d8/DellEMC_Unity_iSCSI/205 : SUCCESS in 1h 44m 39s

Leave a comment with 'run-DellEMC Unity CI' to trigger a recheck. For more information about CI, please see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems/DellEMC_Unity_CI"}, {'account_id': 25678, 'date': '2021-06-03 21:59:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

- DellEMC_SC_FC http://publiclogs.emc.com/61/794661/1/check/DellEMC_SC_FC/2d5c02f/DellEMC_SC_FC/137 : SUCCESS in 1h 03m 30s
- DellEMC_SC_iSCSI http://publiclogs.emc.com/61/794661/1/check/DellEMC_SC_iSCSI/d1d505e/DellEMC_SC_iSCSI/134 : SUCCESS in 1h 30m 39s

Leave a comment with 'run-DellEMC SC CI' to trigger a recheck. For more information about CI, please see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems/DellEMC_SC_CI"}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2021-07-12 14:58:15.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-03 18:03:41.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Make py3 default tox target flexible"

This reverts commit 07999e82faebec6a17fd16e34499b5469c31a042.

This doesn't work in a predictable way across distributions
and versions of Python.

On Fedora 34, "tox -e py3" runs under Python 3.9, which
isn't officially supported by Cinder, so we shouldn't use it
as the default target.

Change-Id: I05032e1be306fec3dc75e9e5a38c98f0f97fe9d6
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Make py3 default tox target flexible"

This reverts commit 07999e82faebec6a17fd16e34499b5469c31a042.

This doesn't work in a predictable way across distributions
and versions of Python.

On Fedora 34, "tox -e py3" runs under Python 3.9, which
isn't officially supported by Cinder, so we shouldn't use it
as the default target.

Change-Id: I05032e1be306fec3dc75e9e5a38c98f0f97fe9d6

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I2d4c19cf44897668697cbfd6efc6d56b3a38d83f

Yeah appreciate that, I still think this more targeted approach is valid here given the need to ensure operators aren't borking things with specific bus or model updates. For example, trying to use an IDE bus when the underlying instance is using the q35 machine type.

commit_message:
Store and allow libvirt instance device buses and models to be updated

This spec aims to outline a basic set of nova-manage commands to allow
operators to move instances between specific device bus and model types
without requiring a rebuild.

Change-Id: I54af69453f396a3577503015cd7da7c958d4507a
Blueprint: libvirt-device-bus-model-update

messages:
[{'account_id': 31245, 'date': '2021-04-12 11:38:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-04-15 13:47:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-07-12 11:23:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I don't really get how this was able to merge.

This is clearly a patch that was wrongly pushed towards master instead of stable/wallaby (as it shows in the topic). Moreover, the very same patch with different change-id was merged just before this patch ( I2f41e05df1cc978821bf7cb6d9a95bf543c7fba3 ).
Strange :S"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-07-12 13:52:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Strange :S

I think it's because this was merged in and not rebased. The merge commit would have been essentially an empty commit. I missed that this was against master instead of stable/wallaby /o\"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-12 11:38:13.000000000', 'message': "Fix requirements issues

This patch is the merge of 2 current fixes that need to be solved in the
same time. Indeed each issue lock our gates independently.

Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

I propose to drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain needed
to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this mechanismes.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html

Move flake8 as a pre-commit local target.

The goal here is to avoid conflicts between flake8 and hacking version each
2 days.

Inspired from nova's approach[1].

The flake8 version to install will be determined by hacking and
requirements[2] will stay aligned instead of relying on different versions.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/branch/master/.pre-commit-config.yaml#L26-L35
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/hacking/src/branch/master/requirements.txt#L1

Co-authored-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5c806d492b22f25b79e6598b2fe3847ba6963220)
Change-Id: Ic94f064f073755bee09495ced4f7627484bf8337
"}]
commit_message:
Fix requirements issues

This patch is the merge of 2 current fixes that need to be solved in the
same time. Indeed each issue lock our gates independently.

Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

I propose to drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain needed
to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this mechanismes.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html

Move flake8 as a pre-commit local target.

The goal here is to avoid conflicts between flake8 and hacking version each
2 days.

Inspired from nova's approach[1].

The flake8 version to install will be determined by hacking and
requirements[2] will stay aligned instead of relying on different versions.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/branch/master/.pre-commit-config.yaml#L26-L35
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/hacking/src/branch/master/requirements.txt#L1

Co-authored-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5c806d492b22f25b79e6598b2fe3847ba6963220)
Change-Id: Ic94f064f073755bee09495ced4f7627484bf8337

commit_message:
WIP db: Add our first alembic migration

The auto-generation found something! Namely, that we're missing
timestamp fields for a number of database models. Add these and improve
our testing to catch this stuff in the future.

WIP because I need to improve the tests to catch this.

Change-Id: I96fd69ad5f29939d79fc55a6f4ea2ee792c354b7
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Changed minversion in tox to 3.18.0

The patch bumps min version of tox to 3.18.0 in order to
replace tox's whitelist_externals by allowlist_externals option:
https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/blob/master/docs/changelog.rst#v3180-2020-07-23

Change-Id: I0cf1a50e43a18984d4f299a551c5bbef483d82ec

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2
> 
> Might be worth to bump to 2.4.0 if we change the API for the list call?

I agree with Thierry, this could be 2.4.0.
@Gregory what do you think? Do you/the team stick to 2.3.1 or want to update to 2.4.0?'}, {'account_id': 29244, 'date': '2021-07-12 12:17:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
>

> @Gregory what do you think? Do you/the team stick to 2.3.1 or want to update to 2.4.0?

"Support pagination for 'list' API calls" is a bugfix. We didn't support pagination and people with a lot of Octavia resources might have a bug with the CLI.
The fix doesn't change the API.'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-07-12 12:43:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

> "Support pagination for 'list' API calls" is a bugfix. We didn't support pagination and people with a lot of Octavia resources might have a bug with the CLI.

Thanks Gregory for the confirmation. LGTM.
* version bump is OK then
* patch uploaded by PTL
* no issues found in test job logs'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-07-12 13:07:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yes, also Xena isn't yet released so we are not stuck by the next series's minor releases"}]

commit_message:
Add ipxe ramdisk kernel append param test

While investigating a bug report, I noticed we didn't explicitly
test passing arguments in with the ipxe interface and a ramdisk,
and given the issue reported was precisely that, I wrote a test.

Change-Id: I801b71d381a69e7b8678b9e60ff36dda0ae3f7fb

commit_message:
init_host should be called before RPC consumer is created

This change adds a new hook to Manager class called init_host_with_rpc()
to allow services like scheduler to do something once RPC is ready.

Copied from cinder https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/65fa80c361f71158cc492dfc520dc4a63ccfa419
and https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/60c563f72d2d6d008fca03f0a058941f3807e1a8

Change-Id: Iac6507a6e395c55f0fec453650009f08c2bb6563
Closes-Bug: #1271568
(cherry picked from commit 0339802a5d0801cda19c464a87853b60982ae011)

commit_message:
Add nova-manage commands to show and refresh connection_info

This spec aims to outline some basic and potentially backportable
``nova-manage`` commands that will allow operators to both view and
refresh the connection_info of a specific block device mapping within
Nova.

Blueprint: nova-manage-refresh-connection-info
Change-Id: I2b4028afa975b4b11acef62452a8d4dc472ebb2e

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-13 02:46:34.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Add a growvols utility for growing LVM volumes

There is currently no automated way of growing LVM volumes on boot
like single partition images do with their growroot mechanism. This
lack likely contributes to LVM not being widely used on VM and
baremetal workloads, since growing to the full disk requires workload
knowledge to determine which volumes to grow and by what amount.

The growvols element contributes a growvols python script which can be
run on firstboot (via systemd or cloud-init) or manually via
automation such as ansible. It is also an iteractive script which
displays the full list of modifying commands before prompting for
confirmation to run them all.

By default the script will grow the root volume, but arguments allow
any volume to grow by a specified amount, or a percentage of the
available disk space.

WIP: needs unit tests on all functions, and a proper mechanism to run
on firstboot with arguments baked into the image.

Blueprint: whole-disk-default
Change-Id: Idcf774384e56cce03e56c0e19c7d08a768606399
'}, {'created': '2021-05-14 01:59:29.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Add a growvols utility for growing LVM volumes

commit_message:
Add a growvols utility for growing LVM volumes

There is currently no automated way of growing LVM volumes on boot
like single partition images do with their growroot mechanism. This
lack likely contributes to LVM not being widely used on VM and
baremetal workloads, since growing to the full disk requires workload
knowledge to determine which volumes to grow and by what amount.

The growvols element contributes a growvols python script which can be
run on firstboot (via systemd or cloud-init) or manually via
automation such as ansible. It is also an interactive script which
displays the full list of modifying commands before prompting for
confirmation to run them all.

By default the script will grow the root volume, but arguments allow
any volume to grow by a specified amount, or a percentage of the
available disk space.

Blueprint: whole-disk-default
Change-Id: Idcf774384e56cce03e56c0e19c7d08a768606399

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-24 00:11:39.000000000', 'message': 'cache-url : turn down verbose curl

curl's "-v" is a bit too verbose for "-x", especially when what you're
downloading bounces through a few redirects as is common.  Turn this
down and put it behind "-xx" or greater.

Change-Id: I6d91166bb237f2a1818cae7532e794ef0f01288b
'}]
commit_message:
cache-url : turn down verbose curl

curl's "-v" is a bit too verbose for "-x", especially when what you're
downloading bounces through a few redirects as is common.  Turn this
down and put it behind "-xx" or greater.

Change-Id: I6d91166bb237f2a1818cae7532e794ef0f01288b

commit_message:
Sharder: Add root_audit overlap stats

We currently log overlaps as a warning in the logs, but having the stats
logged to recon so we can pull the data more readily is a win.

Change-Id: Ida8ea98ad23c63f99a002dc77df49ba8b5bf820e

'}, {'created': '2021-07-09 01:08:59.000000000', 'message': 'Restore configuration after resizing instance

The instance configuration is lost after resizing, which should be fixed
by this patch, not only including the user customized configuration,
but also the replication related config.

Story: 2009033
Task: 42773
Change-Id: I9e3165ed9b38b15714542e35456415e65d438497
'}, {'created': '2021-07-10 02:08:43.000000000', 'message': "Keep user defined configuration after resizing instance

* Never remove user defined config, changing the function name from
  save_configuration to reset_configuration in trove-guestagent.
* Improved some logs
* Do not remove Innodb Log Files after resize which will cause error:
  Can't open and lock privilege tables: Table './mysql/user' is marked
  as crashed and should be repaired

Story: 2009033
Task: 42773
Change-Id: I9e3165ed9b38b15714542e35456415e65d438497
"}]
commit_message:
Keep user defined configuration after resizing instance

* Never remove user defined config, changing the function name from
  save_configuration to reset_configuration in trove-guestagent.
* Improved some logs
* Do not remove Innodb Log Files after resize which will cause error:
  Can't open and lock privilege tables: Table './mysql/user' is marked
  as crashed and should be repaired

Story: 2009033
Task: 42773
Change-Id: I9e3165ed9b38b15714542e35456415e65d438497

Hello Sagi/ Alex,

thank you for reviews.

As Alex correctly pointed this role is currently not used in quickstart.

I have already posted a patch yesterday to utilize it in quickstart: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/+/800215 , Infact during that work I realized log-output for this role was missing.

Result looks promising:-
https://logserver.rdoproject.org/15/800215/2/openstack-check/tripleo-ci-centos-8-ovb-3ctlr_1comp-featureset001/1b6e27a/job-output.txt

2021-07-09 17:09:27.212937 | primary | }

https://logserver.rdoproject.org/15/800215/2/openstack-check/tripleo-ci-centos-8-ovb-3ctlr_1comp-featureset001/1b6e27a/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/tripleo_overcloud_node_introspect.sh.txt.gz

But the above patch is not depending on this change. Just created a testproject: https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/testproject/+/32054 with depends-On both tqe and this patch.

I will post back the results here once testproject reports.'}, {'account_id': 29775, 'date': '2021-07-10 05:51:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> thank you for reviews.

> As Alex correctly pointed this role is currently not used in quickstart.

Hello Sagi,

Looks good as per testproject result:-

https://logserver.rdoproject.org/54/32054/34/check/periodic-tripleo-ci-centos-8-ovb-3ctlr_1comp-featureset001-master/5a50244/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/tripleo_overcloud_node_introspect.sh.txt.gz

~~~
#!/bin/bash
# This file is managed by ansible
set -xeo pipefail

export OS_CLOUD=undercloud
 openstack overcloud node introspect  --all-manageable --provide      >/home/zuul/overcloud_introspect.log 2>&1
~~~

As we started to leverage more role from tripleo-operator-roles - i think would be worth to run ovb third party check jobs here.'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2021-07-12 09:03:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

commit_message:
Migrate from testr to stestr

* Replace .testr.conf by .stestr.conf for migration and update
  .gitignore, test-requirements.txt and lower-constraints.txt
  files accordingly
* Use py3 as the default runtime and 3.18.0 as the minversion
  for tox
* Add group_regex to run all tests

Signed-off-by: HeroicHitesh <email.hiteshkumar@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I704356082e2c25d21aff3c5433efa077259b0b1d

commit_message:
Fix CPO for k8s v1.21+

From k8s v1.21, the cloud controller manager must come with
the --cloud-provider parameter otherwise it cannot start
properly.

Task: 42808
Story: 2009044

Change-Id: I4e6886b82d4584591f2a9325325a51d97d5f6740

commit_message:
[TRAIN ONLY] WIP - Clean up containers with default managed_by

When containers are created with the default
managed_by label, TripleO deployments will fail
to recreate the containers. This happens often
enough that it's work deleting the containers
and recreating them with the correct managed_by
label.

Resolves: rhbz#1976830
Change-Id: I315ed6d8315446faedb85fd038f369a6e73115cc

subject: Run placmeent on an independent port by default
messages:
[{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-08-07 00:59:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-08-10 12:50:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-08-10 13:33:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I think this is valid since installation guides uses port 8778 even though historic discussion and devstack is deploying in port 80 with /placement as URL prefix.

Not doing +w so that others can leave their feedback.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-08-11 14:46:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

maybe send a note to the ML? though i think most folks are overriding it anyway.  If we get no response next week, let's merge"}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-08-31 09:02:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We should just merge this IMO.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-08-31 13:02:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-08-31 13:09:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

Sorry but let me put -2 atm because I noticed that I should update default endpoint urls, too, otherwise the default doesn't work..."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-08-31 13:12:54.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Workflow+1 by Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>
'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-08-31 13:46:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-08-31 13:49:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-08-31 14:12:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review Workflow-1

During updating default endpoint definitions I noticed that placement api has 2 configurations different from the other services.

 1. api_port uses 80 instead of service specific port
 2. path uses /placement instead of /

If we follow the installation doc then we need to change both of the above 2 points, but I'm not confident with "popular" set up especially about 2. For example TripleO still depend on the default /placement path while it use 8778 to override default port 80.

Now I feel that changing 1 only is incomplete, while changing both seems risky, and it would be better to leave the current defaults and have users to set required parameters likr path if they want to use independent port, instead of changing default to uncertain values which can affect existing deployment.

The 2 concern with leaving current defaults are
 - the default keystone endpoint doesn't work on Debian which don't use httpd to run placement api
 - we still need to maintain special defaults
but I don't think these matters much more compared to possible bad effects caused by this change.

I'll wait for any feedback with keeping this patch open for review, but I'd tend to say that I should abandon this.(or does it still make sense to change port only ?)'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-08-31 14:19:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(3 comments)

I'm kind of biased since we're already using port 8778 and doing use any URL prefix, not sure what the installation guide says about URL prefix? We pretty have it like this since it's easier to distinct and was configured this way before Placement was standalone from Nova."}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-08-31 14:23:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-08-31 14:46:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

The current installation guides suggest tcp/8778 without any prefix. I confirmed that this comes from the default wsgi conf file in rdo[1], I'm still looking for the one in Ubuntu but I expect the same regarding the same description in the doc.

[1] https://github.com/rdo-packages/placement-distgit/blob/rpm-master/placement-api.conf#L8"}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-07-12 02:49:03.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

I have restored this work in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-placement/+/800363'}]

commit_message:
Run placmeent on an independent port by default

This patch makes placmenet service use dedicated port, tcp/8778,
instead of the default apache port, tcp/80, to follows the way
described in installation guide[1], and be consistent among all
services deployed as wsgi services.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/placement/latest/install/

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/749058/
Change-Id: I3f669686896b543f751fe2145bdc2f40aaa310bf

job.

commit_message:
Fix oslo policy DeprecatedRule warnings

Since 3.7.0, oslo policy started the DeprecationWarning[1] if
deprecated_reason and deprecated_since param are not passed
in DeprecatedRule or they are passed in RuleDefault object.

These warnings are logged for every test which increase the
log size and sometime can full the log buffer and fail the
job.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.policy/blob/3.7.0/oslo_policy/policy.py#L1538

Change-Id: I5f7b2027e9d015cef6e8e7b459ebf2005c432209

commit_message:
Changed minversion in tox to 3.18.0

The patch bumps min version of tox to 3.18.0 in order to
replace tox's whitelist_externals by allowlist_externals option:
https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/blob/master/docs/changelog.rst#v3180-2020-07-23

Change-Id: I6a2e22840060da9c1156581c1e1cea880d6ec840

messages:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 31857, 'date': '2021-06-29 14:11:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 31857, 'date': '2021-06-29 15:13:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 31857, 'date': '2021-06-29 16:13:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

memo:

* Tacker uses following filter operator:
  https://opendev.org/openstack/tacker/src/branch/master/tacker/api/common/_filters.py#L56-L67
  ```
    FILTER_OPERATOR_SPEC_MAPPING = {
        'eq': '==',
        'neq': '!=',
        'in': 'in',
        'nin': 'not_in',
        'gt': '>',
        'gte': '>=',
        'lt': '<',
        'lte': '<=',
        'cont': 'in',
        'ncont': 'not_in'
    }
  ```

* After filter validate, filters is converted as following (e.g. vnfpkgm):
  https://opendev.org/openstack/tacker/src/branch/master/tacker/api/vnfpkgm/v1/controller.py#L146
  * case of single filter:
    [before validate]:
      (eq,id,a0c6a8ec-a10e-4767-9c4e-279d2230ed05)

    [after validate]:
      {'field': 'id', 'model': 'VnfPackage', 'value': 'a0c6a8ec-a10e-4767-9c4e-279d2230ed05', 'op': '=='}


  * case of multiple filter:
    [before validate]:
      (gt,softwareImages/minDisk,7);(eq,onboardingState,ONBOARDED);(eq,softwareImages/checksum/algorithm,'sha-512');(eq,additionalArtifacts/checksum/algorithm,'sha-256')
    [after validate]:
      {'and': [{'field': 'min_disk', 'model': 'VnfSoftwareImage', 'value': '7', 'op': '>'}, {'field': 'onboarding_state', 'model': 'VnfPackage', 'value': 'ONBOARDED', 'op': '=='}, {'field': 'algorithm', 'model': 'VnfSoftwareImage', 'value': 'sha-512', 'op': '=='}, {'field': 'algorithm', 'model': 'VnfPackageArtifactInfo', 'value': 'sha-256', 'op': '=='}]}"}, {'account_id': 31857, 'date': '2021-06-30 00:22:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 31857, 'date': '2021-06-30 02:14:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 32102, 'date': '2021-06-30 06:41:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 31857, 'date': '2021-07-01 03:06:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 31857, 'date': '2021-07-02 09:29:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

There are fewer tests that fail, but the following tests still fail..

* tacker.tests.functional.sol.vnflcm.test_vnf_instance_with_user_data.VnfLcmWithUserDataTest
  - test_inst_update_heal_term
* tacker.tests.functional.sol.vnflcm.test_vnflcm_noop.VnfLcmTest
  - test_instantiate_terminate_vnf_with_vnflcmnoop
* tacker.tests.functional.sol.vnfpkgm.test_vnf_package.VnfPackageTest
  - test_index_attribute_filter
    -> this test seems be caused by above test failure.'}, {'account_id': 31857, 'date': '2021-07-02 09:30:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 31857, 'date': '2021-07-06 09:25:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 31857, 'date': '2021-07-06 12:47:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

In Patchset 7, I checked the debug log and found that the vnfd_id filter in the `vnf package list` was not working properly.
So, I modified `_vnf_package_list_by_filters` method to filter correctly in Patchset 8.
As a result, multinode-sol job passes successfully!'}, {'account_id': 31857, 'date': '2021-07-06 13:09:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 32102, 'date': '2021-07-06 13:46:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> Patch Set 8:
> 
> In Patchset 7, I checked the debug log and found that the vnfd_id filter in the `vnf package list` was not working properly.
> So, I modified `_vnf_package_list_by_filters` method to filter correctly in Patchset 8.
> As a result, multinode-sol job passes successfully!

Thanks Ueha san for your utmost support and help. In my understanding, "apply_filters" method imported from sqlalchemy_filters was auto joining query & probably this part was missed by me while proposing solution. 
Thanks for proposing solution.
Highly appreciate!!'}, {'account_id': 31857, 'date': '2021-07-08 10:13:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 31857, 'date': '2021-07-08 12:49:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

When I was checking the gerrit patch of aodh, the following patch made the FT of aodh successful.
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/aodh/+/799651

I applied it by describing the url of the patch using depends-on in the commit message.

Then the multinode-legacy job now passes!

So, it looks like we have to wait for the aodh patch to be merged.'}, {'account_id': 31857, 'date': '2021-07-12 00:49:28.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This fix has already been feed back into 796160.'}]

commit_message:
[DNM] Test to fix FT error of patch 796160

This patch is just test patch for FT error of 796160 [1].

The multinode-sol job's test failed following error:
* Failed in tests for retry operation.
  ```
  File "/opt/stack/tacker/tacker/api/vnflcm/v1/controller.py",\
    line 1546, in retry
  body = jsonutils.loads(vnf_lcm_op_occs.operation_params)

  Unexpected exception in API method:\
    TypeError: <class 'NoneType'> can't be decoded
  ```
  The parameter appears to be missing. This patch try to fix it.

And following changes are needed to filter correctly:
* Modify common.apply_filters().
  It support case of multiple models are joined to query.
* Fix `_vnf_package_list_by_filters` method to filter by vnfd_id
  correctly.

The multinode-legacy job's test failed by aodh-client exception,
So, I will try to depend on the patch [2] to see if it can be fixed.

This patch will be abandoned after feedback of the result to 796160.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tacker/+/796160
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/aodh/+/799651

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/aodh/+/799651
Change-Id: I85589e9811404e5a592ede93650bde2420a92196

[{'created': '2021-06-23 13:04:59.000000000', 'message': 'Make explicit the network backend used in the CI jobs

All Neutron CI jobs (except for unit, functional and fullstack jobs),
have explicitly defined the network backend used:
- linuxbridge
- ovs
- ovn

That was discussed and approved during the Neutron CI meetings [1].

[1]https://meetings.opendev.org/meetings/neutron_ci/2021/neutron_ci.2021-06-15-15.00.log.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/797051
Change-Id: Ib14542311e9b1d49829bef54f433b8a04709a9fd
'}]
commit_message:
Make explicit the network backend used in the CI jobs

All Neutron CI jobs (except for unit, functional and fullstack jobs),
have explicitly defined the network backend used:
- linuxbridge
- ovs
- ovn

That was discussed and approved during the Neutron CI meetings [1].

[1]https://meetings.opendev.org/meetings/neutron_ci/2021/neutron_ci.2021-06-15-15.00.log.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/797051
Change-Id: Ib14542311e9b1d49829bef54f433b8a04709a9fd

This looks right. Thanks for fixing it! I was wondering if we wanted to backport this change. 17.0 is wallaby release. Anyone upgrading from victoria -> wallaby will be fine cuz BIOSSetting didn't change. Anyone upgrading from wallaby -> master will work with this fix. Upgrading from wallaby -> 18.0 will not work w/o this change, so we should backport to 18.0. Then we should be good."}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2021-07-08 13:54:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

wonder if it is worth adding a test, eg. make sure every object has a 1.0 in the mapping. Or... make sure every object has an entry/correct version in the 'master' table. Can't remember how we have coded things to know which might be easier. Maybe we can leverage the unit test with the object hashes... (As a separate PR, I'm just thinking out loud.)"}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-07-09 12:56:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Remove broken link from Python-TackerClient guide

In Python-TackerClient guide, under "Indices and tables" section,
"Module Index" refer to a broken link [1].

The documentation build does not generate module index, thus
we can remove the link [1] from page.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/python-tackerclient/latest/py-modindex.html

Closes-Bug: #1934581
Change-Id: I881cb5faaefab3bffb9b7253dcd65e69581488bf

commit_message:
Multi-Version Design for ETSI NFV-SOL

This spec proposes the new design of Tacker to support
multiple versions of APIs defined in Release 2, 3, and 4
specifications. For simple management of different version support,
each version should be implemented in independent manner.
At the same time, redundant logics can be shared in common functions.
The database and object class are also separated from existing
Release 2 implementations.

Change-Id: If7cf03550ad2501c7e4397e50a765e093dcae84c
Implements: blueprint multi-version-api

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-02 15:14:51.000000000', 'message': 'Correct YAML load warning

The use of `yaml.load` without Loader is deprecated and
considered unsafe.

The warning notice:
/opt/stack/python-tackerclient/tackerclient/tacker/v1_0/nfvo/vim.py:
YAMLLoadWarning: calling yaml.load() without Loader=... is deprecated,
as the default Loader is unsafe.
Please read https://msg.pyyaml.org/load for full details.
config_param = yaml.load(config_yaml)

This change adds (Loader=yaml.SafeLoader) to remove the warning.

Change-Id: Idc77d855b41801777d57cfe92d1c448b6e72feaa
'}]
commit_message:
Correct YAML load warning

The use of `yaml.load` without Loader is deprecated and
considered unsafe.

The warning notice:
/opt/stack/python-tackerclient/tackerclient/tacker/v1_0/nfvo/vim.py:
YAMLLoadWarning: calling yaml.load() without Loader=... is deprecated,
as the default Loader is unsafe.
Please read https://msg.pyyaml.org/load for full details.
config_param = yaml.load(config_yaml)

This change adds (Loader=yaml.SafeLoader) to remove the warning.

Change-Id: Idc77d855b41801777d57cfe92d1c448b6e72feaa

commit_message:
Fix Redeploy Playbook

This commit fixes 2 issues in redeploy playbook

- Default value of ironic_url is not set, added default(omit) to use
environment variable for connecting to ironic

- provision_state and maintenance is actually not set when pulling
ironic facts. This commit changes the playbook to refer to the value
registered in node_info.

Change-Id: I261dc97f878a9a8e8bba8f59a4c2886832c68ce9

commit_message:
Support PVs for k8s cluster with MgmtDriver

The Tacker Wallaby release supports to manage a Kubernetes cluster as
VNF instance with ETSI NFV-SOL003 VNF Lifecycle Management
interface with MgmtDriver according to the spec "Support deploying
Kubernetes cluster with MgmtDriver".
This specification proposes that the deployed Kubernetes cluster VNF
has a Storage server with Cinder volume to enable Users to deploy CNF
which has PersistentVolume on it.

Implements: blueprint pv-k8s-cluster
Change-Id: I4be534d4fb94b3ba2feb4718603bcb8dd42ef69e

commit_message:
Enhance Heat input on the basis of NFV SOL014

This specification enhances the Tacker's supported parameters mapped
to the OpenStack's Heat Orchestration Template (HOT).
The specification adds supported parameters and focuses
on how they can be mapped onto the HOT to instantiate the VNF.

Change-Id: Ib3a5df22d19fbe10c3c25385e7f88cb60d299f47
Implements: blueprint support-hot-according-to-nfv-sol014
